q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.
h:
“The more perfect a person is on the outside, the more demons they have on the inside.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
h:
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.” —
Thomas Edison

q: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
h:
“Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.” —
Rumi

q: Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.
h:
“Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: To be great is to be misunderstood.
h:
“To be great is to be misunderstood.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
h:
“Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.” —
Brian Tracy

q: The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.
h:
“The soul should always stand ajar, ready to welcome the ecstatic experience.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.
h:
“Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength.
h:
“Where there is no struggle, there is no strength. ” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: Words used to attract the dull of wit are not to be relied on.
h:
“Words used to attract the dull of wit are not to be relied on.” —
Huang Po

q: You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.
h:
“You are the average of the five people you spend the most time with.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Your neighbor is the man who needs you.
h:
“Your neighbor is the man who needs you.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.
h:
“Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.
h:
“Curiosity is the most powerful thing you own.” —
James Cameron

q: Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend.
h:
“Even when a friend does something you do not like, he continues to be your friend. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy.
h:
“Be not glad at the misfortune of another, though he may be your enemy. ” —
George Washington

q: What you seek is seeking you.
h:
“What you seek is seeking you.” —
Rumi

q: Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.
h:
“Be royal in your own fashion: act like a king to be treated like one.” —
Robert Greene

q: Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.
h:
“Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
h:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: To become what you are not, behave as you do not.
h:
“To become what you are not, behave as you do not.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it.
h:
“The strength of a wall is neither greater nor less than the courage of the men who defend it. ” —
Genghis Khan

q: I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.
h:
“I find the best way to love someone is not to change them, but instead, help them reveal the greatest version of themselves.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.
h:
“I have lost friends, some by death...others by sheer inability to cross the street.” —
Virginia Woolf

q: Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.
h:
“Tomorrow is only found in the calendar of fools.” —
Og Mandino

q: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
h:
“It isn't what you do, but how you do it.” —
John Wooden

q: Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.
h:
“Whatever is begun in anger, ends in shame.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
h:
“If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.
h:
“Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Your life will never be the same again.” —
Og Mandino

q: When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.
h:
“When you know what you want, and you want it bad enough, you will find a way to get it.” —
Jim Rohn

q: There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.
h:
“There is only the one reality, neither to be realized nor attained.” —
Huang Po

q: He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.
h:
“He who is not contented with what he has, would not be contented with what he would like to have.” —
Socrates

q: Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
h:
“Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.
h:
“Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
h:
“Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
h:
“The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.” —
Charles Dickens

q: You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.
h:
“You cannot control the behavior of others, but you can always choose how you respond to it.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you.
h:
“When you are content to be simply yourself and don't compare or compete, everybody will respect you. ” —
Laozi

q: He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.
h:
“He who loses wealth loses much; he who loses a friend loses more; but he that loses his courage loses all.” —
Miguel de Cervantes

q: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.
h:
“Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.
h:
“Family not only needs to consist of merely those whom we share blood, but also of those whom we'd give blood.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Some people find fault like there is a reward for it.
h:
“Some people find fault like there is a reward for it. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.
h:
“Time doesn't heal emotional pain, you need to learn how to let go.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about.
h:
“There is only one thing in the world worse than being talked about, and that is not being talked about. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.
h:
“Giving back involves a certain amount of giving up.” —
Colin Powell

q: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
h:
“It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.
h:
“If the plan doesn't work, change the plan, but never the goal.” —
Unknown

q: Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.
h:
“Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.” —
Thomas Jefferson

q: Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
h:
“Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success. ” —
Henry Ford
